utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, I had the most exquisite class this evening. My students are rehearsing the boxing scene from Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf?.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just glad they were using your studio and not my living room.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh… you’re making me your fabulous pasta carbonara. Oh! You shouldn’t have.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t. Actually, it’s for Alexis. She’s just been, you know, a little busy lately. I thought we’d uh… reconnect. So, her favorite dish and then a screening of Saw 4: The Director’s Cut.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah. I hate to tell you this, darling, but she won’t be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean? Where else would she be?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: She’s starting a new internship.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Another one?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: She did say she wanted to try a few things to find her passion.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s 9 o’clock. What kind of passion is she finding at this time of night?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Um… Ah ha. There. Your better half.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t change the subject. What is this internship, exactly?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, Alexis swore me to secrecy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but as her father –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah ah ah ah. My lips are sealed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then you won’t be using them to eat my pasta carbonara.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: All right. Well, let me say this. This internship has my personal seal of approval.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t make me feel any better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Truth is, the internship isn’t the problem. It’s the fact she now has three of them.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well you never know, Castle. This might be the one that brings you two closer together somehow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I doubt it. Best I can hope for now is she learns to become more of an underachiever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m sure you’ll be able to give her some tips.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, neighbors heard a hellacious fight and then our victim here sailed out of that fourth floor window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was that his apartment?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re checking, but it doesn’t look like it. Tenants don’t recognize him and he doesn’t have any ID.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: No ID, but lots of causes of death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean, other than gravity?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh yeah. See that bullet wound?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was shot before he fell?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And stabbed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shot and stabbed?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And choked. And has a pencil jammed in the side of his neck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Gives new meaning to the term ‘overkill’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did anyone see his attacker?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, we’re checking with witnesses, but I figure that our perp slipped out of the building during all of the confusion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s go see what they got.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Alexis.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing here? Is this – is this your new internship?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dr. Parish agreed to let me shadow her. I thought if I go to med school this would give me a better grasp of forensic pathology. I’ve learned so much in just two days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweetie … why wouldn’t you tell me?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I guess I was afraid you’d veto it. Like maybe me being here was invading your territory or –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s crazy. I wouldn’t – think that. That’s – this is great.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is – I just – I just don’t know if you should be exposed to crime scenes and dead bodies.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, I’m already used to it. It’s equal parts gross and cool.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I heard that and I couldn’t agree with you more.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I finally get why you’re into this, Dad. Now I’m into it, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My worlds are colliding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean Alexis?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You knew about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle. You’re the one that said you wanted to find a way to spend more time with her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not like this. This is my thing. This is our thing. It’s a violation of church and state.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This would be like me just showing up at her school and teaching.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I really think that you’re overreacting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But what if I’m not? What if this upsets the delicate synergy of our partnership? What if it undermines our unit cohesion?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See? Major problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not that. This.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a lot of blood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One of our witnesses saw a man leaving the building. He was limping.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our suspect was injured.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and the trail goes that way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A brutal killer betrayed by the frailty of his own flesh, his path revealed by that most primal stain. Except the path ends here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Multiple drops in one spot? He must have stood here for a minute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He got into a car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if he did, maybe he got caught on tape.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: First 911 call came at 8:42, just after our victim crash landed. So our guy probably made it to the corner a minute or two later. Hey, pretty cool about Alexis’s internship. Or not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There. That’s gotta be him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s wounded, the cops are after him, and he’s looking for a place to go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s got a hostage. Track the taxi off the medallion number. Find out where it went.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD, hands in the air! Show us your hands!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get up, hands in the air.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get up! Put your hands in the air. Hands on your head, now!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Drop to your knees.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thomas Gage. For the record, have I advised you of your rights?

utterance.speaker: THOMAS GAGE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Including your right to an attorney?

utterance.speaker: GAGE
utterance.content: I won’t need one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: GAGE
utterance.content: Looks like he took a nasty fall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he had a little help. Fingerprint evidence will show that he was thrown out a window. By you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After which, you kidnapped Tina Massey in full view of a security camera.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Murder plus kidnapping. That equals more years in prison than you have left. Unless you cooperate.

utterance.speaker: GAGE
utterance.content: Everything that you have on me? Or you think you have? It’s all going away. And we’re done here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This guy should be sweating bullets. This doesn’t feel right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like he knows something we don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I want you to pull everything you can on Thomas Gage.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Problem is, that’s not his real name. His driver’s license is bogus and his prints aren’t in the system. Bottom line is, we have no idea who this man is.

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: The guy was super calm the whole time. Not big on chit chat, either. His opening line was ‘Get your ass in the cab or I’ll kill you’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about when you went back to your apartment? What did he talk about?

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: After he promised not to murder me, he asked me to patch up his leg. He had a real gash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could you tell how he got the injury?

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: He said he got slashed with a knife. While he was killing a guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he admitted that to you?

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: More like just made the statement.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And did he say who this guy was or why he killed him?

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: All he told me was that the man doesn’t exist.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The man doesn’t exist as far as I can tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you haven’t ID’d him yet?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Look, I’m trying. But his fingerprints aren’t in any database, which is weird because I thought for sure he’d have a criminal record.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How come?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s not the first time this guy’s mixed it up. Old gunshot wounds, calloused hands from martial arts training. More broken bones than Evel Knievel. You’re not going to believe his x-rays.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Where’s my John Doe?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Where’s my John Doe?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He was right there when I left. I was only gone a minute.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I know he was right there, I was just about to cut him open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, now he really doesn’t exist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How does a body just vanish from a morgue?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Thomas Gage does. Remember what he said? Whatever you think you have is going away? He’s in on this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, did Gage get transferred to central booking yet?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, he’s still in holding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s going to give us some answers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is this guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He was here. I – I secured him myself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lock down the precinct.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. On it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey Dad. I tried to wait up but you must have gotten in really late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not by choice. Our suspect pulled a Houdini so they locked down the entire station. But by then the mysterious, steely killer, going by the nom de guerre of Thomas Gage, was long gone. Writing up notes on this case is solid gold material for my next book.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wait, the guy who threw John Doe out the window, he escaped?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh huh. But only after orchestrating the theft of John Doe’s body from the morgue. How awesome is that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not so awesome if you’re the person who let it happen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh honey, it’s not your fault.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I was with that body. But a friend called. I stepped away to talk. I didn’t –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, hang on. Listen to me. I’m glad you weren’t there. Because the kind of person that took John Doe’s body is the kind of person who wouldn’t think twice about hurting whoever got in the way.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Still, I thought working with Dr. Parish there’d be zero chance I’d make a mistake that would affect a patient. I mean, how could I, right? But then I found a way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, honey, if this internship isn’t the right fit I’m sure Lanie would understand.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. Dr. Parish gave me this opportunity and I want to see it through.

utterance.speaker: VICTORA GATES
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The apartment where John Doe was killed, we think Thomas Gage was squatting there -

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t care where Gage was unless it tells me where he is now. But I’m very interested in knowing how he got out of that holding cell on your watch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re not clear on that, sir. But we do know how he left this precinct.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I assume he snuck out of the back exit?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, he went out through the front door. This is him heading to the lobby.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Where did this man get a uniform?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He stole it. From the locker room.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Find out what else he did. Check our security video and retrace his steps. I want to know every move that he made.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gage has been two steps ahead of us this whole time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not only that, but he must have a partner who took John Doe from the morgue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which still doesn’t explain why he ended up wearing those blues. Why risk stealing a uniform when he could have just walked out of the building?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll tell you why. He needed something inside our precinct. The guy got into our database.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looking for what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not what. Who.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tracy McGrath of Queens. He ran her name and I think I know why. Her address is unlisted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if getting arrested was part of Gage’s plan? So he could access our data for Tracy’s address.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you guys pull up everything you can on Tracy. Castle and I’ll go over there now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her phone’s going straight to voicemail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is her connection to all this? Why is Gage so interested in her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With any luck, she knows who Gage really is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tracy McGrath? NYPD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo? Yeah, we got here too late. Uh, she’s got one to the back of the head. Can you call Lanie and get her to bring CSU down here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Captain Gates. Looks like Tracy McGrath was Gage’s next victim.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What do we know about her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, she’s 33, no family, a scientist at a research foundation.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All right. Talk to her coworkers. Find out why Gage would have wanted her dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like she’s been here awhile.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, it makes sense. Gage escaped last night. He had a 10 hour lead on us. You stay put. I’m going to check the rest of the place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? What –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Where is everybody?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We usually beat the uniforms to the scene. It’s not like they want to hurry and stand around.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Just so you know, I’m not letting this victim out of my sight.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Crazy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What is?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The fact that Richard Castle, a man unburdened by regret and guilt, has a child that carries the weight of the world. It is not on you that a dead man came up missing.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, how often does something like that happen, anyway?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It never happens, honey. So relax. It was a freak thing. Bodies just don’t disappear.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, I see where the blood stain is.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Where’s the body?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. You?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where the hell are you taking us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wherever it is, it’s way down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … uh … I don’t know. I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA TURNER
utterance.content: Rick Castle, at a loss for words? That must be a first for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sophia Turner.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Hello, Rick. Welcome to the CIA.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And what kind of work did Tracy do, exactly?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did she have any enemies? Anybody that might want to do her harm?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have an idea where she went?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re going to need access to her computer, her email, her documents, everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Secret underground headquarters? This is straight out of James Bond.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’re avoiding the question. Who’s Sophia Turner? How do you know her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… it’s a… long story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’ll take the short version.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Let me give it to you.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: What’s it been? 12 years?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 11 and a half.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Rick and I met when he was just beginning to do research on his first Derrick Storm novel. He wanted an up close and personal look at the life of a female CIA agent. So I gave him one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re Clara Strike? The Clara Strike from the Derrick Storm books?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: I wouldn’t say that I am Clara Strike, but I like to think that I inspired Rick in some small way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that is just fascinating.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: You look good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so I hate to interrupt this reunion, but we’re being illegally detained. At least, I am.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: This is not a detention. This is a debriefing. Approved by the NYPD. Feel free to call Ted McQuinn.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The chief of detectives?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: He assured me you’d give us your full cooperation. I need to know everything you know about Thomas Gage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not until you tell me what the hell is going on here.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Fine. But that would be getting into highly classified information regarding national security, which if you were to reveal it to anyone would be considered a treasonable offense against the United States of America punishable by death. So, you still want to know?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN DANBERG
utterance.content: We recruited Thomas Gage out of SEAL Team Six in 1997. Smart, highly trained, fluent in 11 languages, Gage was our most effective asset. We sent him into conflict zones, failed states all over the world. Gage was adept in every situation. Unfortunately, he went rogue.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Based on NSA intercepts, we believe that Gage is trying to initiate a catastrophic event which poses an imminent threat to the country.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that man that Gage pushed out the window, he was CIA.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Gary Harper. One of our best. We got a tip on Gage’s whereabouts, we sent Harper to bring him in. Obviously, that operation didn’t go as planned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At which point, you took the body from the morgue.

utterance.speaker: DANBERG
utterance.content: This is a national security crisis. We didn’t want the NYPD underfoot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, good to know. So how did you guys get on to Tracy McGrath?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: We monitored data from your precinct. Her name came up, but unfortunately by the time our agent got there she was already dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why did Gage kill her?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: We were hoping you would know.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: You can go ahead and answer that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I was planning on it.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Would you mind terribly putting it on speaker?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, you’re on speaker.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. So uh … word came down from chief of d’s. That said you were on some sort of special assignment. What’s that about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a long story. What’d you get on Tracy McGrath?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It may be nothing, but she ditched work yesterday for two hours. She has a notation in her day planner but all it says is ‘Pandora’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Let me get back to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s Pandora?

utterance.speaker: DANBERG
utterance.content: According to the chatter, Pandora is the code name for Gage’s mission, which means that the McGrath woman is mixed up in it.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Now the two of you know as much as we do. Look, you have done impressive work on this case. I want you to take the lead in finding Thomas Gage.

utterance.speaker: DANBERG
utterance.content: Sophia.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Martin, we are up against the wall. CIA is barred from domestic investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, isn’t that what the FBI is for?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Thomas Gage is a hired gun. We don’t know who he works for or how deep this goes. All I am asking is that you continue your investigation and we will share all information we get on him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what’s the catch?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: That you do the same. And that you report only to me. This has to stay between us. Our techs have uploaded icons on both your phones which will connect you to my direct line. You’ve seen what Gage is capable of. He’s one of our most dangerous operatives and I have no doubt that whatever he is planning he is completely capable of carrying out.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: I wouldn’t put you in this position, but this man has to be stopped. Can I count on you for your help?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you realize what this means? We’re spies. This is like being in a Jason Bourne movie, only he’s the bad guy and the CIA are the good guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That remains to be seen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, wait. I’ve got to see those direct dial icons they put on our phones.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Why’s mine a panic button?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess she really does know you well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. You’re upset.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not upset.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then what are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I am … just a little bit uncomfortable with the new command structure. I don’t like keeping secrets from my own people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re sure this isn’t about Sophia?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, why would it be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Maybe because I based a character on her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, don’t flatter yourself, Castle. It’s not that big an honor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. Because Sophia is on our side. We’re on the same team.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that doesn’t concern you? You don’t think that that will undermine our ‘unit cohesion’?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I am willing to let that slide in the interest of national security.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I guess I am, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s just, I might have been a little bit taken aback to find out that you had … researched with someone else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, it was never the way it is with you and me. I just hung out with her for a while, to … lend some authenticity to Clara Strike. It was a brief moment a long time ago. And besides, Nikki Heat is a far more nuanced a character. She is. And I’m a far more experienced a writer. More mature.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One out of two is …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how long did the two of you hang out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A year? That’s your idea of a brief moment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was young and she had a lot to teach me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll bet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About the shadowy world of espionage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me ask you this. How many other women have you semi stalked in the name of research?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this a trick question?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I don’t even want to know.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. Mr. Castle. Good of you to drop by. So, tell me about this special assignment of yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m afraid I can’t, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes … it’s on a need-to-know basis.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And I need to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I think that the chief of detectives would back me up on this one.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well. We’ll see about that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Did you see how mad she was? God, that was so good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, seriously. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys, I’m sorry. We really can’t talk about it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon. This is us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Hey, sorry boys. Classified. Top secret. Our eyes only, def-com one. And if I did tell you? Well then, I’d have to kill you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? Good luck with that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, realistically that’s not –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m gonna go on record and say that this sucks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sucks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And noted. Now, let’s move on to Tracy McGrath. Where’d she go after she left work?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, according to her EZ-Pass, she drove down the Jersey turnpike and exited somewhere near Newark Airport. We’re still trying to figure out where she went.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the answer’s still at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no signs of forced entry or struggle. It’s like she knew our killer, she let him in, she walked in front of him and he shot her in the back of her head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means she knew Gage. So how’s a climate scientist mixed up with a ruthless ex-CIA agent?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how is she connected with Pandora?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s gotta be something here that ties them together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she has excellent taste in cars. An auto repair manual for a 1967 Pontiac GTO.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s funny. Keys are sitting on a pile of yesterday’s mail. She drove it before she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except there’s no GTO on the street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or in the garage. So where’s the car?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I see a recurring charge on her credit card. Looks like she’s paying $100 bucks a month for Frenchie’s Parking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: $100 bucks? That’s not going to get you a space in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bingo. Billing info says that Frenchie’s is in Elizabethport, New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s right near Newark Airport.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the mystery ride Tracey took has to do with the GTO.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There it is. Now that is some classic Motor City iron.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 400 cubic inches with a Rochester four barrel and 360-horsepower.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know muscle cars?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah. We should go to the track sometime, see who laps who.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, why do you think Tracy took off work to come down here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe to drive it to a clandestine, Pandora related uh … rendezvous?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, look at the dust on this. This hasn’t gone anywhere in a while.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look. Maybe she came to stash something in the trunk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Handprints indicating someone’s been in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is not original equipment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but it’s probably why she came here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Wait a minute – wait a minute. We don’t know what’s in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, there’s only one way to find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it might be Pandora.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As in, Pandora’s box. As in, opening that could unleash an unstoppable tide of evil.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that’s a myth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m speaking metaphorically. Gage is planning a catastrophic event, right? So what if there’s a doomsday device in that case set to go off when you open it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And ground zero is a parking garage in New Jersey? I doubt it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just – ah…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is a military grade cell phone and a scrambler. That’s spy equipment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tracy came here to make a phone call and I bet you that the last number she dialed is still on the phone.

utterance.speaker: GAGE
utterance.content: Close the case and turn around. Hands in the air.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gage.

utterance.speaker: GAGE
utterance.content: Your weapon and phones on the ground.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? You put your hands in the air.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: GAGE
utterance.content: The phones? On the ground?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just upgraded. This is a brand new phone –

utterance.speaker: GAGE
utterance.content: Now. I’m afraid you’re not going to like what comes next.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bracing myself to shield you from a hail of bullets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, that’s very gallant of you but you can stop bracing. I think he left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. My life was passing before my eyes. I think I lost track of time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you know about trunk latches?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um… well… bad news is this one was not designed to open from the inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the good news?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At least this time we’re not handcuffed together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s surprisingly roomy in here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well it’s not that roomy. Sooner or later we’re going to run out of air. We gotta get out of here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well maybe somebody will find us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we are locked in the trunk of a car in long term parking. It’s going to be hours before anyone notices we’re missing. Who do you think is going to find us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just feel that in situations like this it’s important to have faith.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You pressed the panic button, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well if there was ever a time to panic I think this is it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You should be thanking me!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! I am not gonna be rescued by your girlfriend. Move, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah! What are you –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need to get under there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This. Here. Is it in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To the left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Push.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scoot down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: AGENT JONES
utterance.content: For you.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: I believe this is yours. Agent Jones found it in the parking structure.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Finding the car was great work. I think it might just be the break we need.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I can’t take all the credit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, especially because it was Detective Ryan who found it.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Well, in any case, the phone is obviously key or else Gage wouldn’t have gone after it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tracy McGrath used it on the day she died. Maybe she called someone connected to Pandora –

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: And then Gage eliminated her and took the phone to tie off all loose ends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which still doesn’t explain where Gage is now or who Tracy called.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Well we’ll find that out when we trace the call she made.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Gage took the phone. How can you do that when you don’t know what number she called or even the number she called it from?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: By using all the coolest toys.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Bring up Newton Foundation to Frenchie’s Parking commute time by car at 3PM yesterday via the turnpike.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Factoring in the time it would have taken her to get to her car, let’s say she got there at 3:45PM. Pull up all cell phone traffic for the next 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Filter it to calls just to New York and New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Now just payphones and unregistered cells.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Calls under a minute. She would have kept it brief.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Okay, now triangulate those 42 signals and let’s see which one originates closest to that parking structure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: That’s gotta bet the number Tracy McGrath called. Get me eyes on that payphone. Any local surveillance yesterday at 3:56PM.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Zoom in.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: He looks familiar. Freeze there?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Oh my God. That’s impossible. He’s supposed to be dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is he?

utterance.speaker: DANBERG
utterance.content: Dr. Charles Blakely. Mathematics professor. He was a legend at the agency. Genius. Consulted for us, but died in 2002. Or at least that’s what we thought until just now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he faked his own death. This just keeps getting better.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: No, it doesn’t. Not with what this man is capable of. Blakely devised math based predictive models for us. Models to help create geopolitical change.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean by that?

utterance.speaker: DANBERG
utterance.content: The agency would bring him a problem – how can we prevent country A from getting a bomb, or cause regime change in country B. Blakely found solutions using what he called linchpin theory. His approach was to find a small even that could trigger a large event.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like the assassination of Archduke Ferdinand causing World War I.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Exactly. He once said that you only had to knock over one domino but if it was the right domino the rest would fall. If Blakely is the one who planned Pandora this is beyond a worst case scenario.

utterance.speaker: DANBERG
utterance.content: What if Blakely is just a hired gun. Like Gage?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: He’s not the one behind this.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: What’s he saying?

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: Meet me Thursday at 5PM. Bishop A5, bishop C4, pawn E3.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chess moves?

utterance.speaker: DANBERG
utterance.content: Blakely was a world class chess player. It’s some sort of code. Run that pattern against anything in the encryption database.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: This takes us into a sensitive area.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For your eyes only. I get it.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Thank you so much for everything.

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Agent Jones will show you out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. What about Gage?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: We need to invest all of our resources into finding Blakely. He’s the weak link here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, but if you find something on Gage you’ll let us know?

utterance.speaker: SOPHIA
utterance.content: Absolutely. We’re in this together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what I think? I think we should crack that chess code.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CIA can handle it, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With their track record? I’m not so sure. Just saying. Look, we decipher that code, we can save this country from a nameless cataclysmic event.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, if you want to go after Blakely, go ahead. I’m a homicide detective. I have to find Thomas Gage and I can’t do that by answering to Sophia Turner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He killed two people, Castle. Do you think she even cares about that? No. She’s got a whole different agenda.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, like saving the world. We’re all on the same team here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you’re on her team. Because the way you look at her you’re sure as hell not on mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: AGENT JONES
utterance.content: This is a secure facility. We need to keep it that way.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I just had a talk with Alexis. I am so pleased you are on board with this internship.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I was forced to be on board. How could you let that happen, Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh darling, don’t be silly. And you’re just in a foul mood because you had a spat with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not in a – How did you find out about that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, wait. Let me guess. Beckett to Lanie to Alexis to you. See? This – this is what I was afraid of. For your information, we did not have a spat. I simply chose to work at home today.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: On a case involving vanishing bodies and special assignments.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? She told you that, too? Is nothing sacred?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Not much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes well, in any event, I’m not allowed to discuss it.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, please. When has that stopped you before?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well clearly it’s time I started setting some boundaries around here.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can tell you this much. I’m working on a code involving these three chess pieces, the answer to which could avert a catastrophe.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Two bishops and a pawn. What could it mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve been looking up classic strategies, I’ve looked up famous chess matches with Fischer, Karpov, Kasparov, but this pattern never occurs.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Maybe the pieces have nothing to do with the chess game. Maybe the pieces represent something else entirely.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. Nothing on Gage, but remember you asked me to look for a link between Tracy McGrath and some guy named Nelson Blakely?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I found one. From 10 years ago. Tracy and a bunch of her grad student friends went on a white water rafting trip with a Dr. Blakely, their professor. Although it wasn’t a good time for him. He drowned during the trip.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he fakes his death and Tracy was in on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who fakes his death? Blakely?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh – I’m sorry. I can’t tell you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know, a man can only take so much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. What’re you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I found something. It’s about Blakely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well shouldn’t you tell Sophia about it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s not my partner. You are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: May I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Bishop, bishop, pawn. We know Blakely was a world class chess player. Tracy McGrath played too; she had a game timer. Yet this placement makes no tactical sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m guessing you’ve got a theory?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think the pieces have anything to do with the game. I think Blakely was leaving Tracy a coded message telling her where to meet him. Maybe even a place where they play chess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well uh … people play chess in parks. Uh, Central Park, Washington Square Park. Those would be great places to meet up with someone without drawing attention.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Now, what if each piece stood for a first letter of a word. Bishop for B, pawn for P.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, B and then 7 spaces. That could be … Brooklyn. And Blakely make his phone call from Brooklyn, so BBP. Uh… Brooklyn Bridge Park?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That meeting is at 5 o’clock. That’s in half an hour. If Blakely shows we can find out what Pandora is. And we can find Gage. What do you say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Blakely should have been here by now. Maybe he knows that Tracy’s dead or maybe Gage already killed him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Choose the audacity of hope. I say he’ll be here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shouldn’t you call Sophia?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And look like an ass if I’m wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I have to admit. I’m actually kind of surprised that you’ve never mentioned her before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wasn’t allowed to. She is an active CIA agent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look. If you want, I will answer any question you have about her. Anything at all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, it’s really none of my business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Well then, we’re done with it then.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … how close where the two of you exactly?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon Castle. You said I could ask you anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, seriously. There he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Blakely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, there is no mistake.

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: How did you find me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Through Tracy. She’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: If they got to her they can get to me. We need to leave here. Now.

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: I always knew this day would come. But Tracy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Blakely, what’s going on? What’s Pandora?

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: I need you to drive me to Pier 32.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not in a position to bargain.

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: I got in this car voluntarily and I’ll get right back out if you don’t take me where I want to go!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, what’s at Pier 32?

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: Once we’re there I’ll tell you what you want to know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were top of your field. A professor. An advisor for the CIA. Why fake your own death?

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: I brought down nations for the agency. I played God. But my linchpin theory didn’t factor in the human cost. I knew they’d never let me leave, so I died. And was reborn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the only one that knew was Tracy.

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: She was my lifeline. She steered consulting work my way. I … helped reduce cholera in Africa. I predicted that a lone act of civil disobedience would trigger an uprising and remake the Arab world. I – I did good things. Who killed her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The same man who’s trying to pull off Pandora.

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: You mean they’re trying to make it happen? This is even worse than I thought.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Talk.

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: I need to go inside first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not going anywhere until you tell me about Pandora. What is it?

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: It was the name of a white paper that I wrote.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For whom?

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: I was hired by a think tank to identify weaknesses in US security, so they could be shored up, protected. I found an alarming vulnerability. A linchpin that was tied to the economy that would cause crisis and devastation beyond anything that we’d ever seen. The dominos would just never stop falling. I asked Tracy to follow up with the think tank, but they don’t exist. Whoever they are, I gave them the blueprint that will bring about the end of our country as we know it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dr. Blakely, what is the linchpin?

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: A flock of pigeons.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Blakely, the linchpin. What is it?

utterance.speaker: BLAKELY
utterance.content: Pigeons don’t fly in flocks unless they’re fleeing a predator. They’re here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait! Wait, wait!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Blakely!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, c’mon!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hold on, Castle! Hold on!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Break! Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hold on, Castle!
